DGoQMe6_wtCPeFAA6clWAg.text: Best pie I've had since Australia! Been looking for one for ages and it was delicious. Had the deer stalker and it was just perfect. Flaky crust and piping hot. Better than the leather lane location.

livsIQolL9WoLCZ1dAXyEw.text: Meeeeeaaaaat!The best meat pie ever! It's so delicious, crust included. Gone are the days eating the filling out of a dry gray colored pastry. Instead I'm rather happy to receive a Matador pie and savor every flavorful bite wrapped in flaky pastry.

m5QQCH1BRx8FHnuFvvuzJg.text: Some of the best pies money can buy!I devoured a Heidi Pie today, covered in mash, gravy and their ridiculously good minty mushy peas.I've been a fan of Pie Minister for somewhile now, having come across them all too often at music festivals across the land and their regular market stall in Clapham. Boy they're good. When I found out they had a shop within walking distance of my office I shrieked in delight (really). This place is almost dangerously close to my desk. I could be in trouble/bankrupt.I'm knocking off one star for their lack of indoor seating. In the winter you either freeze your gonads off on the outdoor seats or skulk back to the office to eat your prize.

1vU-yd4ujSE7ARLUF9EzBg.text: The only reason I can give for not giving my beloved Pie Minister 5 stars is that they always seem to sell out of the most popular pies before I can get to them! If you like Pies, and not just a casual liking for Pies, I mean a core shaking love that has changed your life, then this is the place for you. Unwrapping that joyous little cardboard box and digging your eager fork into the pie is like opening the greatest christmas present in the world!  The only bad thing about these pies is that eventually each pie comes to an end...  Get a loyalty card and try each and everyone of these pastry fellas, then eventually you will be rewarded with a free pie- hooray!

0uv9IwVpoTANK9zqXF9GAg.text: Pie Minister has been on my bookmark list of places to try for a while so was looking forward to trying it out. I like the concept of the place and the fun imagery with the little icons for the different pies. I had the chicken of Aragon pie with mash and minted peas and gray. Mmm. Pastry was crisp, filling tasty, great mash and peas and gravy and good portion size.Perfect comfort food and good prices too. Another example to show that good food and quality doesn't have to be expensive.I wish there were more locations! This one on the Southbank is slightly tucked away so you have to seek it out and closes fairly early in the evening (we just made it before closing).

6EybLgxnSzL31pqxSR-fCg.text: Student special prices, totally solid pies, gravy, mash, minty peas. What more can you ask for?Pieminister is to pies what gastropubs have been to pub grub. They've done them up without (typically) destroying their soul.And that's a Good Thing. A better thing when you're a student & you can get a pie with everything for a fiver, but still decent at full price.

GvHcb5sSOlGpaWxSMgg-zw.text: Love the compact meat pie! Great for grab and go. So compact, so hearty, and so good.Would eat one now if only I were still in London...the Pie Minister definitely spoke to my epicurean soul! Yes, please, I'll have another.The pie we devoured was chicken, tarragon and bacon. With brown gravy poured on top, this was a mini pie masterpiece. My husband and I even went back a few days later to get another pie (or three), but, alas, they were closed for the bank holiday. On my next UK visit, this will definitely be one of my first stops.HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

rOKbe-GqBhpijiavbOCcTA.text: I had the Heidi and my bf had the Shamrock with the Mothership.  Both pies were awesome but (I hate to even say it) the mothership might have been a little bit much.

aIwDb4hHqYVH6T62aa7pcQ.text: Stunningly good pies - solid, crunchy crusts full of texture with delicious fillings. I've tried both the Wild Mushroom & Asparagus and the Chicken versions and they were equally delicious. The gravy is vegetarian which is a nice touch, and the take-out trays the deliciousness are put in are cute. Staff at this branch were friendly and efficient and gave good recommendations, and there a variety of interesting soft drinks to choose from. The only issue I have is the mashed potato which tasted a little too "minty" (cross contamination with the peas!?) and a little too baby-paste smooth for my tastes, but it's the pies you come from and they are A1. I can even overlook the groan-inducing puns on the menu ("groovy" instead of gravy, etc). Bravo! Will be back for another fix soon.

vCe9Yi2oDLm0HCfXKmk8Yg.text: That was a good pie. No question. I had the deerstalker pie for lunch which had venison (as you might expect) and lentils and some other delicious ingredients that can be summed up in one big YUM.  Nice minty gravy and the best mushy peas I've had in England. The only downside is seating is VERY limited. There's one little counter that holds about 2 diners at a time. However there are a lot of little tables outside and in good weather I'm sure they are packed because the food is amazing, inexpensive and filling. I will be back here when it gets a bit warmer. Also, you can get pies to take away which is a fabulous idea and even cheaper.

fjWKu1V6x_wft5V2HYOGUw.text: Pie Minister was a great way to cap off a morning of shopping in the Gabriel's Wharf area.  They have a simultaneously limited and varied menu of offerings.  Limited in that it is pretty much just pub pies and chips, varied in that they have at least a dozen types of pies.  The wife got a chicken pie and I tried the pork.  Both were delicous, and the accompanying chips were perfect-leading to two stuffed bellies and an inability to sample more of PM's tasty wares.I would love to have the opportunity to go back and try more. hopefully sooner rather than later.

DuB4HHgzuODJ5b4IaFNzTw.text: best meal i had in london. and i dont think im just overzealous because of the clever name. the best compliment i can give is that i think they would do well in los angeles too, all the meat pies (i tried four between my friends and my own) were delicious and fresh.i remember it was hard to choose. everything on the menu sounded appealing, i had the bleu cheese beef something and my friends tried the world cup (sorry england) flavor with chorizo and rosemary chicken  something. the details dont really matter, all i know is that i ate it all. the sides of potatoes and gravy and peas were really delicious too (and also devoured)meat pies should be what you advertise to the world, or at least the meat pies from the cabinet (another clever pun) here. they were savory and perfect on a typical drizzly june day in london.tourists: if youre on your own walking tour of the thames, then pie minister is the perfect stop for lunch between westminster and the tower bridge (before tate modern and the globe)

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom

2Mpi71MJggXDGMUdOKoOaA.text: ATTENTION ALL PIE LOVERS... Pie Minister is now serving SWEET pies! Today I sampled a pear and chocolate pie. It was filled with poached pear rum and chocolate in a similar toasty pastry as their savory pies. It was served pipping hot (so don't burn yourself)! So satisfying and a nice sweet treat when you're in the neighborhood. They currently only have three flavors: Adam's Apple Pie (apples & raspberry), Lovely Pear Pie (pear & chocolate), and Toffee Apple pie. I can't wait to try them all.

hs1pzl0Z10w34Vode6a2NQ.text: Their Wildshroom & Asparagus pie is the perfect cure for a rainy Monday morning. With it's perfectly flakey crust and delicious vegetarian ingredients it warms you right to the core. Just don't let it burn your tongue!

JQ10RMMlH4DQDtsJtAAC9g.text: Excellent food. I had the Chicken of Aragon with mash and gravy to take away. It was absolutely FANTASTIC! The flavors were perfectly balanced and the mash was fresh with a good texture. Can't wait to go back and try some more of these delicious creations!

p942jI82mAzji0aX9Qdbgw.text: Delicious tasty pies~!  Best I had in London.  Ordered the Heidi Pie (sweet potato and chevre) and the Mint and Lamb...both covered in gravy. ummmmm Wish I ordered more.

_4CybtxbfpVGzqikoWg7lw.text: Delicious, wholesome & filling pot-pies!  I was in heaven when enjoying my yummy dinner on that cold, autumn evening.  Hit the Spot.  Would Order again, if I return to London.

y9PmJhh-dKKmf4r7tEaC-A.text: Saw reviews to choose which place to try my first london pie. And I'm Definately happy I got to try it here. You can taste the ale in the original moo pie. Delicious and tasteful gravy. A pint would've been perfect with this.

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom

0PobWyLtLbqQenXtaKiYIg.text: Okay, so I love the idea of handheld pies and wish we had them in the states. Good price at the borough street market and filled with meaty goodness and delicious mushrooms. Craving one now as we sit in a deluge of snow on the east coast.

dwJ7tUrHNkueBjHU53R5ag.text: OK gang, first things first.  I didn't actually get to eat at this particular Pieminister location.  I just happened to be walking along the South Bank and saw it.  I thought I knew all the places along that part of the South Bank, so I went to check it out.  Sure enough, there it was in all its glory, a Pieminister location that has, apparently, been there for quite a while (I'm not quite sure how I missed it, although it's sort of tucked away in a corner and can easily be missed).So, I didn't eat there.  However, I've no doubt that if it's anywhere close to the quality of the Pie Ministers that I've been to, then you're in a treat.One other thing, on Mondays, the Mothership is £6.00, instead of £8.50.  But you have to ask for it as they tend not to advertise it.Also, don't forget to pick up your free frequent visitor card.

hHC2rZ7hUWDQSiaTzMsDHw.text: While on vacation (I'm from California), I was looking for an unforgettable meat pie to try, and I found it! There's nothing healthy about these pies, but they sure do taste good. As a bonus, the walk from the London Eye along the river to Pieminister was beautiful.My husband and I split a Shamrock Mothership, and it was plenty of lunch for the two of us. It was a steak and Irish stout pie, served on a bed of mash, topped with minty mushy peas, gravy, cheese and fried shallots. Messy, but wow, so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Shamrock Mothership

vDV-MnhoniftJMpvlCz3Fg.text: Really good pies. A favorite when I come to the UK. The moo blu was really tasty. Nice beef pie with a hint of blue cheese. Smothered with brown gravy on a bed of mash. Delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Enjoying a great pie

Ocr_9CIJSyQq2NdJFsbYiQ.text: London yelpers recommended this place for a pie, and for 5£ I couldn't imagine a more appropriate meal while in England. I went long and ordered the steak and kidney pie with mashed potatoes, mushy pies and gravy.  Yea, it tasted organ strong like heart, but the sauce had a luscious hint of wine and the pie crust and gravy were perfect. I went to the nearby church and joined the throngs of business men and women on lunch.   Itinerary recommendation: Lunch here at borough marketCheck out the Tate ModernGet a groundling ticket at the globe theatre.Boom.

Avn98H7QmspsBAe5Pv-qzg.text: Who doesn't love a good pie with mash and gravy? I know I do, especially in the winter time when it's cold, pie is my favourite comfort food to grab for lunch. I am quite happy that I have a pieminster shop near work and I have visited it a fair few times to try out all the pies. So far they have all been amazing, I particularly recommend the matador one. While I normally get it in a box to eat at work I also like sitting at the southbank shop to have my pie and look at all the people walking past Gabriel's Wharf. They also provide blankets in the winter which I think is a lively touch to make you feel cosy and keep warm.

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom

GkenFFpbOstaKqstMrGsWg.text: Located in a very quaint center, everything is free range, fresh, and DELICIOUS! Loved the place it's a must go to!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Chicken of argon with free range chicken, smoked bacon, and tarragon. Yum!

s5pHbWD6x8pFQ_nI37egeA.text: Delicious pies, good prices (£4.50). We had two of the steak pies, and one chicken. All had unique flavors, good crust, and delicious filling. Sides were ok, but didn't love them (mushy peas + beet slaw)

IFNI1hLUQe70auZkYz6ctA.text: Pieminister place is so freaking good! I first experienced their excellent pies and mash at Borough Market on London. They had a vendor at the market and I found their staff really friendly and helpful. After asking some questions, I ordered the Moo pie (steak and ale). It was incredible! The best pie i've ever had. The steak was so tender, the gravy delicious, and the pie crust so soft and crispy at the same time. It was out of this world. If you are ever in London, you have to go to Pieminister. Its a requirment.

k8HUateokIN-aFDnHj0zmg.text: This place is perfect. Literally anything you buy is delicious. Best pie and mash in London. Hands down! And it's not expensive! Definitely worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Our pies!! We got the hot pies with mashed potatoes and gravy.

HVbaXZGv9jjEBIgyBvH7Xw.text: I really like this place. I visited London for a few days and having a meat pie was on my to-do list. The pie was simply amazing and I would definitely come back for another one whenever I visit London again.

1J2pj4BnXi-7fGskG4UHUw.text: Review for the table at Portobello Road.  Amazing fresh tasty pies made with buttery crispy crust for a reasonable price.

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom

fqycrVETPsWO7OEQAOr-Sg.text: Pieminister is always a treat for a cold day - great value pie and mash meals and so many great flavour choices of pies to boot.I arrived here on a very rainy day, desperate for a warm meal, and found a cabin-style shop with only 2 stools and a small bar to perch on! I waited patiently for about half an hour for the previous customers to leave, but it was worth it.  On the other side, there is plenty of seating outside - perhaps this is one for a drier day...The upside is that this is in a new group of shops and stalls just off the main South Bank walkway - easy enough to find, but hidden enough to be quieter.

mRelsdYLlnyk-UtaGG6xFg.text: Cake with meat? At first, I was kinda sceptical, but it tasted well. I added mashed potatoes, onion and fine beer, and it resulted as really decent dinner. Atmosphere of this place is nice and modest, but is not suitable for a longer visit - the seats are horribly uncomfortable!

I_vx09tcq7N-dX13llCB1w.text: It's not Cornwall by any stretch of the imagination, but then, where is ? Oh, right ... Cornwall is. But you get my point right ?There is a tiny amount in indoor seating, and mostly covered seats outside. I'm not sure what it would be like on a wet day, but on a bright crisp winter's day, it's pretty awesome.Considering the location, prices are really reasonable. You can get a pie for less than some cups of coffee in surrounding stores. If you don't want to sit outside the shop and eat, get your pie to go - you're only a few steps away from the Thames. Picture it... 3C outside, beautiful blue sky, clippers, rib tours and other boats going by and the steam wafting up from the hot, fresh pie you just bit into. And not just any pie - venison, beef, chicken, weird fruity stuff that should have been eaten by the thing that's in the pie but they chose to put into the pie instead. Then the scene gets ruied slightly by the cry of "ow, fooey, bah, darn that's hot"... But once the swearing settles down, it's you, an amazing city, the river that runs through it and meat and sauce in pastry. What more do you want?

O2ZfvFlaVc6cjbkQgSAMnA.text: After sightseeing around on a chilly day, we were excited to see some pie and mash. It was the perfect meal. A piping hot pie atop a heap of delicious mashed potatoes, bathed in a rich, glossy gravy. YUM! The pie was wonderful with it's flaky yet hearty crust. The meat was tender. I only wish they had a bit of indoor seating because the blustery wind chilled my food.

jcNEFlkQixhpNDof1FVeQA.text: Enjoyed the Tate Modern this morning, then lunch at Pieminister. Worth the trip- I had a mushroom asparagus pie with mushy peas- awesome!!! Husband enjoyed a steak and kidney pie. Updated authentic British cuisine. Will head back next time we're in London!

Dj_fDSzcMiNsZ5cXRe3tJQ.text: If you want a good meat pie with some mushy peas, this small shop on the south bank is a good place to go.

gGfNTB0uwRMwYBHPK1W_Vw.text: Another pieminister :)I got one of the beef pies with a drink, mash and mushy peas. They were all very good :) On par with all of the pieministers that i've been to.Come here early in the day as since the most popular pies run out throughout the day

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Pie mash and mushy peas

IHmQl_wp1Teh2Crb-2zjyw.text: This is not going to be one of my thorough reviews, but I felt the need to remind myself on Yelp how much I loved this place when I went here during my visit to London.+ Good selection of pies+ Yummy & delicious!+ Cute area around itOverall, I would love to come back here again in the future to get my pie fix. When you come to America, you let me know! :)

WKQqTlQGcD3zgFZotTUSSQ.text: This was worth the travel. It happened to be meat Monday so I was suppose to receive .50 pounds off but the cashier forgot. I reminded her shortly after and this was a great lesson for the folks that does not check their receipts like me. There were so many pies that I wanted to try and after eating the mushroom pie, I wanted to order more to go. I suggest asking for the sauce on the side because your pie will get drowned. I made that mistake and had to struggle draining it. The pie is perfect without the extra sauce. It's extremely flavorful and moist, the crust is perfectly flaky and not dry. I wish they had this in NYC. They would make bank!

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Inside mushroom
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Mushroom
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Beef steak

FLQs1xxqdpQwwVLCO5Lr5g.text: I found Pieminister via a Buzzfeed post that recommended 21 cheap eats in London. True to its words, a pie and a lemonade came out to 6.5 pounds, which is a great bargain in London. Pieminister is just a few minutes walk from Big Ben and London Eye, and offers a great snack (or meal) to your stroll along the Thames River. I was indecisive between the Minty Lamb pie (seasonal and a contest winner) and the MooDog pie (because smoked bacon, duh). I went with the Minty Lamb pie at the last minute because I was told that there would be gravy and because it is a contest winner. I was rather disappointed when I opened my takeaway box and there was no gravy! Should I have asked for gravy with a wink and a nod? Who knows - just make sure that you ask for it because the pie was a little dry without the gravy. Albeit, the crust was flaky and buttery and the filling hit the proper savory level, but I still wanted the pie to be just bursting with umami flavor. Don't get me wrong - it was a good pie, and I would come back to try another one but I definitely missed the gravy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Minty pie

lU_KNVFe2s4RriRiXBLNfw.text: Coming to London I had pie and mash on my list of foods to have. I went to another restaurant earlier in the week and was sadly disappointed, but I then came to Pieminister and it was all fixed! Very tasty, fun names, friendly staff plus it was all a reasonable price. Also, who can pass up the name?

HukPhFppXw86y0yK5ncofA.text: Not your regular pie, I had the fungi and the tarragon chicken with gravy. The portion is big and heavy if you eat the whole thing. But it's quite heavy and since only the top part is crunchy I only ate the inside and the top. The sides were really thick and doughy so I didn't bother. Two seats inside and ate the pies inside, so much warmer. Free water and wifi as well, so not a bad place to get a snack.

Q5eWODKOh22PJXvH-nQ2nQ.text: I wonder when the gourmet Pie craze will hit the US? If it does, hopefully this franchise makes it way to NJ. I'll be a frequent customer!Hopefully soon enough - Loved the concept, style, and variety of food they have here. Some pairings were unique - i totally forgot what i ordered, but seemingly it was a popular item according to the store. It had peas, leeks, chicken and a bechamel sauce, in a nice crusty pie, that i then had smothered in gravy! I also had a side of mushy peas - which had a hint of mint and other savory herbs that was pretty damn good, if you ask me.

o022_BDCAibV8B2b0PULtg.text: Maybe I'm just not a fan of savory pies, but I wasn't a fan. I went to the Pieminister stall in Borough Market because I had heard great things about it and therefore had fairly high expectations. Upon arriving at the stall I was pretty overwhelmed by the number of choices, but ultimately opted for the Tipsy Chick per recommendation of the person working the stall. I was super excited to try it (even more so because of the cute box it came in!) but was sadly disappointed on the first bite. The crust wasn't flaky enough (the top crust came off in one big chunk) and the stuffing was just alright. It literally tasted like a regular chicken pot pie you can get in the states. So overall I thought my pie was underwhelming to say the least. It wasn't awful, but definitely nothing special.Also - for the health conscious, beware. Even though their pies are pretty small, they each have ~600 calories and LOTS of fat.

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Tipsy Chick
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Cute packaging!

PhyZESnj_KGqt8c1BPDVBg.text: Fast and efficient traditional pies. The pies are excellent as is the mash and gravy. A must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Wild shroom pie - I love it!!!
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Moo pie
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Chili pie - spicy and delicious!

vwFickTM_QxMmmvEBycz2A.text: We were just strolling along the River, preparing to have some in the Chinese Food Festival at Gabriel's Wharf. But found out the festival was just okay. So we tried to yelp to see if there's anything worth trying and we found pie minister.The pie was actually pretty good, large enough to have me full. Great tastes with mixed chicken and mushrooms. Gravy was also delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom

L9GfNN8wPPSadwc8cGIXag.text: When in London...English food  :)We didn't go to any English restaurant because there were too many good eats just at outdoor food markets! Pie minister was one of them. GREAT VALUE!So let me tell you - the portion is a solid one person meal. If you are going to do a good crawl, then pace yourself! Lol I shared a Heidi Pie and it was still a lot of food.The Heidi Pie was very unique with veggie and goat cheese. It was sweet and savory. The crust is perfection - gotta have that carb to compliment the filling haha

kmTOpLLwNUDdLq7KOQscmg.text: Decent pies with a lot of traditional and new twist choices - however there was no pie and mash with liquor (green parsley/eel sauce) so we were disappointed. Also we had walked 20 minutes to arrive and it was a cold day so we were looking forward to a nice warm restaurant and we found that this place is takeout although there are outdoor tables. We sat and shivered eating our pies but I guess that made it more authentic. The pies did a good job of filling our stomachs.

mKz6XZVmhaumE4Iy0F2htw.text: Stopped by this place after going to the Tate. Really good pies. They also offer a couple of gluten free pies! My wife said her gluten-free pie was nice and flaky. As far as I can tell this chain is the only places to get gluten free pies in London.

C5kfRkXF6K4NHn60Duxlpw.text: When in London, must try some meat pies with mash and mushy peas right? Well this  place does it right! We got the Minty Lamb pie with gravy (british lamb, mint, carrot, swede & red wine) and the MooDog pie (Brewdog 5AM Saint Ale, british beef steak & free range british smoked bacon) with mash and minty mushy peas. The pastry was so crispy and flaky, the mash was done perfectly and the mint in the mushy peas wasn't overpowering the taste of the peas -  just the right amount of mint flavor. Both the lamb and moodog pies were delicious and tasty, but my favorite was the moodog. It was pretty much like eating homemade beef stew. We also ordered a latte from them which was perfect for the cool and windy day we had last week. The locale of the store wasn't hard to find, but walking along South Bank, you would definitely miss it because it's kind of tucked in a corner behind another restaurant. They are in a little area with small shops and a few cafes. Also there are no seats inside the store - only tables outdoors. It was a little windy and chilly when we went so she provided us with some blankets to use.

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Moodog Pie (brewdog 5am saint ale, british beef steak & free range british smoked bacon) w/ mash, minty mushy peas and gravy

iU0PnopRbN1AgWgz2HbJ6Q.text: Delicious pies at a reasonable price. Wished the inside seating was bigger but hey, maybe taking the pie to eat along the Thames while people watching is a better experience anyways. Why not trying coming here for a quick lunch before a theater performance?

8gIyz9EycexuPejmMr1EQg.text: Great place to eat. We came during our holiday in London... One of the best places we ate at. There were four of us, and we each got a different pie... All loved each one. Having only outdoor seating was the only downer... But we made it work on a sunny but cold December afternoon. A definite must eat if you're ever in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. So good. Top: Beef and chorizo pie. Bottom: chicken pie. Both very tasty.

koQeUsy_cueGzzjLZIAqgA.text: Apart that you cannot sit inside, this place is pretty good! Actually the pies are amazing and you get free gravy  though personally i dont find them as cheap as other people do, they are not very big. Outside it was actually really cosy because blankets are provided and there are candles on the tables. I would not go here again as i'm not a big pie fan, but you should definitely check it out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom

h1kQFBlnZEE3JD8UGGzoPw.text: Pie Minister. Minister of the pies. The gravy, the pie, and hold the vegetables. If you like pies then boy do they have a mouth watering menagerie of meaty bundles of joy awaiting your cravings. I kid you not these guys make pies so good, they make pukka pies look like pound shop pastry puffs. Very well priced.

AzzeVIMXz6Zdqq5RRW8qBQ.text: While on a very long walk from Buckingham Palace to the Tower Bridge I came across this place.  It was in a very cool area off the walkway that parallels the the river. I had a warm pie with mash potatoes.  Both the pie and the potatoes were very good.  Of course, My opinion might have been biased since have not met a potato I did not like.An added benefit is the place has free wi-fi which was a bonus since I did not want to use any of my international data.  I was able to quickly FaceTime my wife while sitting at an outdoor table. I would go back

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom

oBGV7e2ueKVxd_U5v6Ykqw.text: Singing bye, bye to American pie.  Drove my feet down the Thames levee and this shop caught my eye.  With them flaky crusts and savory insides, singing this will be the day that I die.  This will be the pie that I'll die (for).

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom

PJrKIwJcp1pV5VggFeWp0g.text: This was the first lunch stop we made while in London. I was looking for a place that had nice pies in london because it was a go to for me while living in New Zealand. I found pieminister thru yelp and decided to give it a try.One of our pies had chicken and ham and the other one had venison meat. There was a nice little sitting area right outside the stand, (and because the weather was great) it was nice to just sit outside. Flavor and taste wise I would recommend this place for a quick/cute/filling lunch! I didn't expect for the pie to be as filling as I thought. If you order the motherload you get all the toppings, but if not you get one side and the option of gravy is free. I would recommend just getting the pie + 1 side, but the motherload was nice for the photo!

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Top: The Motherload 9 Bottom right: pie + 1 side 7

4_XPJNmjKAYRhz6Bbvzvlg.text: It's s one person shop so expect wait times and minimal table service.Steak and kidney pie was just ok. I can say I tried meat pie in London and move on.  The sauce was actually quite tasty. Actually had bits of carrots which is a nice touch. Just the top crust is not as flaky as I hoped it would be.Purple slaw was very simple. Vinegar and cabbage.

Fu7bVIqyUmwP3t8qtHYTpw.text: Affordable and filling!We went to Pieminister after visiting the Tate Modern. We sat outside at one of their tables after ordering at the counter. I got the saag pie with cabbage slaw and my husband got the beef with mash.My pie was tasty with saag filling (spinach and Indian spices) with paneer cheese. It was the perfect size for lunch. I wasn't crazy about the cabbage slaw--a bit too vinager-y for my taste.My husband enjoyed his more traditional beef pie with a beer braise. I wish I had ordered that one as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Saag pie and beef with mash.

Glv7OzMF4p3IzWP6_uZYew.text: Wow, Pieminister was the most affordable AND most delicious meal I had in London. I realize that it doesn't look the most appetizing, but don't let its appearance deceive you.I ordered the Moo classic pie (beef steak) with a side of mash and it was amazing! The filling was so meaty and flavorful, the crust was crispy and flaky, and it all went perfectly with the gravy and mash. It also helped that it was freezing cold outside (I'm from California though so I honestly think any whether under 65 degrees F is freezing) and even though we had to sit outside, the steaming hot food warmed my insides up. Honestly, I tried some other traditional British food on my trip but none of it was that good except for Pieminister. And compared to how expensive food is in London, I can't get over how cheap and filling this meal was! Highly recommend going.

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Moo pie with mash

GHXPvX8i5mnlU0qSH5sL-A.text: 5 stars? Nope 3.5 yepOpened at 12.   By 12:10 there was a line to order and no seats. 12:12 we get our grub and find a seat.  Mine ok but could use more filling.  His ok but could use more filling Owners/staff were beyond friendly. Ok on to the next place.

nFghdkhavqpbxeSIpx-Mug.text: I was told that mash pie was a must in London since it's their signature dish. I was planning to grab one from the famous Menzis but couldn't make it to the shop. I was walking around on my last day and randomly spotted this place tucked away in a corner near the London eye and went for it.I ordered the moo and blue, deer stalker, chicken Aragon and the free ranger with mash and peas. The crust was great and had a tender and flaky texture to it. The free ranger and chicken Aragon had a chicken based gravy inside along with some veggies. It tasted identical to a chicken pot pie from the states and had a very thick gravy. It was good but was nothing to brag about.My favorite was the beef based pies, the moo and blue and deer stalker. The gravy inside the pie wasn't thick nor thin and went better with the pie than the chicken gravy. Also, it was the perfect ratio of gravy, meat and veggies.The beef pies was a lot better than the chicken pies and I would recommend the moo and blue. Pie isn't really my cup of tea but it hits the spot when you're hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Moo and blue on the left, deer stalker in the middle and free ranger on the right. Moo and blue was my favorite.
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom

UkknvKmkPLu4Vj_oRNBklw.text: All I wanted was a pie! And we are walking and find a place that serves pies, gelato and coffee! What else can you ask for? It is a little street food market in the heart of London right on Gabriel's wharf. They had some veggie options as well. Veggie options were sweet potato with goat cheese. Saag paneer and also a mushroom option. Meat options were chicken and mushroom, steak and lidney, lamb, deer. Etc!

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom

r5BSFe73OfIuiOdh3le-xw.text: I dream about Pieminister sometimes.British food gets a bad rap sometimes because it can be terribly unimaginative. Think fish and chips, bangers and mash, pie and mash. But get off your high horse -- not everything needs to be in the running for a Michelin star to be a familiar go-to. You don't need to have any sentimental (or genetic) connection with the good ol' rainy U.K. to see that a lot of these pies are simple, yet comforting.So in other words, I feel like I'm lazing around in a blanket burrito whenever I go to Pieminister.I conveniently choose to forget that I don't actually eat red meat because the Free Ranger (chicken, ham, leek, and thyme) is just that good. And it says a lot about Pieminister that I don't go into gastrointestinal distress a few hours after scarfing down the Free Ranger because my body usually protests against red meat. In Pieminister's defense, you can hardly taste what little ham there is though because this pie is essentially the chicken pot pie of your childhood.It's heavy and can hardly be any good for you. But the crust is oh so crispy, the gravy is perfect, and the chicken is juicy. It'll warm you right up on a cold winter day (but good luck finding anywhere to eat it because you'll have to duke it out for the two seats inside) and it'll give you the energy to thoroughly explore the Tate Modern afterwards.And it'll only cost you £5. Where else can you find a filling meal in London for a fiver?!

luZ3d5YBGjNcyEmLitfyQQ.text: The mushroom and asparagus pie was pretty good. Not great, but good. The crust was really hard on the outside and not very flaky. Maybe it's supposed to be like that? Mashed potatoes were ok. Not super flavored. Gravy- also ok. Located in Gabriel's Wharf, it's a small little place with outside seating only. It's a pretty cool little area near the London Eye. Other pies sell out, so go early. Most were sold out at 1pm on a Sunday.

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Inside of the mushroom asparagus pie (with mash & gravy).
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Seating area.
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. Mushroom & asparagus pie w/mash & gravy (gravy is vegetarian).

UrBB5_DXFhW5X9KTGaUt_Q.text: Went to their shop in borough market and was left disappointed. Their mothership moo pie tasted really bland. Gravy was funky and mashed potatoes tasted like the powder instant kind that comes from a box.

Hd7DRve97xfKHRNKhvKJ5A.text: These were my first pies in the UK, and now, after having had a few in varying price ranges, they turned out to be my favourites. We went for a meat pie as well as a vegetarian pie and both were great. Tl;Dr I recommend these to the max, not only were they the cheapest pies I had during my stay in London, they were the tastiest as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. 1/2 of a Veal and 1/2 of a Sweet Potato pie.

yX0hqjheomeGKqayUbXMIQ.text: Very good meat pies at a nice street food market. The veggie pie was really good. Service was nice.

Y4fu7mYJql6_MqX_jhj8ZA.text: Tiny little place with seating right outside snd tons of other benches/tables nearby as well. It's a great location right by the River Thames off of the main walking path of Gabriel's Wharf. Super cute little shopping area that its in as well. Split the Moo pie with my friend which is a beef steak and craft ale pie. It was super delicious! The filling had tons of flavor and the outside was flaky and crunchy. We walked back onto the main part of the wharf and sat on a bench facing the river and people watching while we ate. I would love to go back and try some of the other pies. It's a great idea to make savory pies and I'm not sure in the Twin Cities have something like this here but would be super excited if they do!

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom. The moo

iXOdYymM5a3OGaSzRI0iPA.text: While working nearby, I had to make sure that my team and I were well taken care of during late nights and weekends stuck at our computers.  Because nothing is ever easy, some of the guys were vegetarians, while others wanted their meat and couldn't have cared less about "garnish".  Thankfully, after fruitlessly digging through menus to find a compromise spot, one of my colleagues grabbed me by the arm and said "Come along, son.  I'll show you how it's done."  Pieminister wound up being lunch for my team nearly every day I was there.  I just couldn't get enough of the Matador and MooDog (which is a Moo, but with bacon...which makes everything better).  My vegetarian guys loved the Wild Shroom (mushrooms & asparagus pie) and Saag Pie-Neer (just what it sounds like - in a huge flaky crust), while those with the hunter's spirit fell for the Deer Stalker and Chili con Carnage (both of which feature venison).  With a pie and 2 sides only costing £8, I also knew I wasn't going to break the bank to buy everyone lunch every day.While sitting outside and watching life on the Thames and the riverwalk go by looked attractive, I never got a chance to enjoy that.  Pick a good day and enjoy the neighborhood before those new apartment buildings finish being built and the area gets crowded.  If you're taking away as I was though, call ahead to make sure that your pie is available, as this location is small and they have run out of stock on some of my requests.  Also, while you're here picking up, do be sure to load up on any additions to your pie - the bottle of HP sauce and whatever else your heart desires are on the little pickup counter just behind you when facing the cashier.  Don't drown the pie though - they make them with love, and you'll want to taste it.Oh - and don't forget to get a pie punch-card.  You can quickly line up enough pies to get a free one, and it just doesn't get better than that.

wmBiwzsqMz0Ud5zenG-6cA.text: Very bad service, super rude. Never coming back again. They need better manners. I am very disappointed since I was looking forward to trying this place since it is supposed to be one of the must go places to eat pies in London.

R7923nqjaX5eIg0m8RtHoA.text: Nice piece of London eateries. Tucked away in the market you might miss it but its worth the look to find it.  There is a plethora of various meat pies to choose from and by far the friendliest of staff.  Where eating there or for takeaway it is well worth the adventure to find and experience.

v1zSsulGl1SHLaUhZyeWrg.text: Ordered some vegan options and they were pretty good. Peas, spinach, and chili fillings. Huge portions and great taste, not to mention the price was reasonable as well. Spent less than 10 pounds and wasn't able to finish the food. Would definitely come again.

d_JU8xDhSZbOkZyE-6oMxw.text: This place lived up to the hype for sure, I ordered the Mothership Saag Pie-neer, and it was incredible. Great vegetarian option full of paneer, peas, chili, and spinach. Came here after a biking tour and had worked up an appetite, good thing too because the Mothership is huge! But also a great price at £8.50, and I had to finish it, it was too good to let go to waste.

photos.caption: Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pieminister - London, United Kingdom

PiaRZ8SKtD88L_1_iBuwCw.text: Very tasty meat pie! Not a huge fan of the mushy peas, but that's just my tastes.  If you are looking to try one of these while in the UK, recommend this place!

noMWBsIaYHe_rT0O3PpKpg.text: This was probably one of our favourite meals while visiting London. We loved the eclectic atmosphere of the shops, cafés and restaurants in this little nook off the side of a main walkway. We ordered the moo pie and the chicken of Aragon pie and they were both lovingly stuffed with delicious ingredients. If that's not enough, the crust was flaky and tender and perfect. They have a good thing going here. With a few other locations, this place owes it's success to quality food, good prices and servers who seem to enjoy and support this brand. Back to the food, the gravy that was generously poured over the pie was flavourful and complimented both both the brown sauce and white sauce filled pie. We ordered a side of mushy peas to go along with it and these taste fresh and bright with a hint of mint, yet had the comforting texture of a mash. I definitely recommend this place for anyone craving a belly warming meal or snack in London. Your stomach and wallet will thank you!
